Field Detail

COOLDOWN_PERIOD

static final long COOLDOWN_PERIOD
Once a key has been requested a few times, don't request it again for 30 minutes. To do so would be pointless given ULPRs, and just waste bandwidth.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

COOLDOWN_RETRIES

static final int COOLDOWN_RETRIES
The number of times a key can be requested before triggering the cooldown period. Note: If you don't want your requests to be subject to cooldown (e.g. in fproxy), make your max retry count less than this (and more than -1).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

succeeded

void succeeded(BaseSendableGet get,
               boolean persistent)
Tell the scheduler that a request from a specific RandomGrabArray succeeded. Definition of "succeeded" will vary, but the point is most schedulers will run another request from the parentGrabArray in the near future on the theory that if one works, another may also work.

Parameters:
req - The request we ran, which must be deleted.

queueCooldown

long queueCooldown(ClientKey key,
                   SendableGet getter,
                   com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
After a key has been requested a few times, it is added to the cooldown queue for a fixed period, since it would be pointless to rerequest it (especially given ULPRs). Note that while a key is on the cooldown queue its requestors will still be told if it is found by ULPRs or back door coalescing.

Parameters:
key - The key to be added.
Returns:
The time at which the key will leave the cooldown queue.

isRunningOrQueuedPersistentRequest

boolean isRunningOrQueuedPersistentRequest(SendableRequest request)
This only works for persistent requests, because transient requests are not selected on a SendableRequest level, they are selected on a {SendableRequest, token} level.
